thread.title: LSU and Miles have respect for opponent Eastern Michigan
thread.title_full: LSU and Miles have respect for opponent Eastern Michigan

title: LSU and Miles have respect for opponent Eastern Michigan
text:
LSU and Miles have respect for opponent Eastern Michigan FOX Sports 
Sep 30, 2015 at 10:08p ET + 
Miles believes the MAC is a quality conference Chris Graythen / Getty Images   10:12p ET 
LSU possesses the nation's most electric running back (and perhaps best player) in Leonard Fournette . The New Orleans native is averaging 8.6 yards per rush. This week's opponent, Eastern Michigan (1-3), is dead-last in rushing defense. Couple that with the fact LSU is a 44.5-point favorite in this contest (as of Wednesday night) and the Tigers should win handily. 
Head coach Les Miles doesn't necessarily agree with that take. In fact, he was very complementary when speaking about the Eagles. 
"If you watch the players, their players can play. The offense is averaging over 400 yards," said Miles. 
The Eagles can definitely put up points. They've scored less than 34 points only once during the first four games of the season. Coming out of the MAC, Miles also appreciates the football hailing from his native midwest region. 
"I have a lot of respect for the MAC," said Miles. "If you saw what Toledo did, I'm guessing the MAC has a lot of respect. I'm not going any further than recognizing it's a quality league, quality football and we've got to play well."
